definitions.name: Bug
definitions.description: Used to acknowledge and identify code that has a live issue even though a resolution has not been identified or implemented.

definitions.name: Major Fix
definitions.description: Identification of a major fix that is important to communicate and potentially worthy of moving the [incr] version # forward if any exist during deployment (major.minor.incr).

definitions.name: Minor Fix
definitions.description: Identification of a minor fix that is important to communicate and potentially worthy of moving the [incr] version # forward if any exist during deployment (major.minor.incr).

definitions.name: Slow
definitions.description: A piece of code that is slower than desired and need refactored.

definitions.name: Todo
definitions.description: Uncompleted feature.

definitions.name: Consequence
definitions.description: A side-effect that may occur either by the behavior of the code or if a change is made to the code.

definitions.name: Dead Code
definitions.description: Typically code that is commented out or code that exists but is never used.

definitions.name: Security
definitions.description: A note about security in relation to the context, not necessarily a risk.

definitions.name: Insecure
definitions.description: An identified security issue.

definitions.name: Test
definitions.description: Test scenario that appears to be missing

definitions.name: Toxic
definitions.description: A piece of code that is extremely tempermental, developers should be cautioned, and refactoring is required.

definitions.name: Cite
definitions.description: Used to identify external resources (like StakeOverflow, blogs, etc) that would add value to the context this attribute is applied to.

definitions.name: Feature
definitions.description: A distinctive function/attribute about what the application does.

definitions.name: Location
definitions.description: Piece of code that appears to be in the wrong place.

definitions.name: Major Change
definitions.description: Identification of a major change that is important to communicate and potentially worthy of moving the version # forward if any exist during deployment (major.minor.incr).

definitions.name: Minor Change
definitions.description: Identification of a minor change that is important to communicate and potentially worthy of moving the version # forward if any exist during deployment (major.minor.incr).

definitions.name: Naming
definitions.description: Intent is clear.  However, naming could be cleaner.

definitions.name: Readability
definitions.description: Hard to read at first glance for one or more people.

definitions.name: Reviewed
definitions.description: Used to tag that an area of code has been reviewed by one or more people.

definitions.name: Standards
definitions.description: A piece of code that needs refactored to adhere to code/design standards.

definitions.name: Clarification
definitions.description: Readable, but missing a 'good to know' for people trying to understand.

definitions.name: Future
definitions.description: A potential future scenario, in which this will need to be changed or these are some insights about the change.

definitions.name: Hack
definitions.description: Working feature.  Requires refactoring due to shortcuts needed to make it work.

definitions.name: Purpose
definitions.description: Unsure of actual intent.  Might be doing too many things.

definitions.name: Refactor
definitions.description: Working feature that needs improvement

definitions.name: Dependancy Inversion
definitions.description: [The D in SOLID] Depend upon Abstractions. Do not depend upon concretions.

definitions.name: Don't Repeat Yourself
definitions.description: (DRY) Every piece of knowledge must have a single, unambiguous, authoritative representation within a system.

definitions.name: Interface Segregation
definitions.description: [The I in SOLID] Many client-specific interfaces are better than one general-purpose interface.

definitions.name: Least Knowledge
definitions.description: [Law of Demeter] A component or object shold not know about internal details of other components or objects.

definitions.name: Liskov Substitution
definitions.description: [The L in SOLID] Objects in a program should be replaceable with instances of their subtypes without altering the correctness of that program.

definitions.name: Occams Razor
definitions.description: The path with the fewest assumptions should be selected even if other directions may eventually prove correct.

definitions.name: Open Closed
definitions.description: [The O in SOLID] Software entities should be open for extension, but closed for modification.

definitions.name: Separation Of Concerns
definitions.description: The design should divide areas of concern into their own distinct sections.

definitions.name: Single Responsibility
definitions.description: [The S in SOLID] Each context of code should do one thing and thus have only one reason to change.

definitions.name: You Aren't Gonna Need It
definitions.description: Always implement things when you actually need them, never when you just foresee that you need them.
